Package components

Class ArgumentsParser

java.lang.Object
components.ArgumentsParser
public final class ArgumentsParser
extends java.lang.Object
Parses command line arguments.

Used to parse and validate passed command line options or print help information to the user. Parsed arguments are stored to be accessible for other components of the tool.

Since:
2.0
Version:
2.0
Author:
Simon Hackl

      private final java.util.ArrayList<ReferenceFeatureEntry> referenceFeatures
      ArrayList of ReferenceFeatureEntry objects representing features to analyze. Each feature specifies the genes name, their parent (i.e. the genome) sequence and locus.

      private final java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.io.File> pdInputFiles
      HashMap mapping String objects representing gene names to File objects specifying .pdb files, one for each reference feature (i.e. gene) to analyze.

      Boolean value to indicate if debugging mode is enabled.

  • Constructor Details

    • ArgumentsParser

      public ArgumentsParser​(java.lang.String[] args) throws MusialCLAException, org.apache.commons.cli.ParseException, MusialBioException, MusialIOException
      Constructor of the ArgumentsParser class.

      Used to parse and validate the user command line input. Parsed arguments are stored - and accessible by other components - via class properties.

      Parameters:
      args - String Array containing the command line arguments.
      Throws:
      MusialCLAException - If any error occurs during parsing or validating an MusialCLAException is thrown.
      org.apache.commons.cli.ParseException - If any parsing error occurs.
      MusialBioException - If any faulty data was specified (i.e. features on the reference sequence with length 0).
      MusialIOException - If any error occurse during input file validation.

      Prints help information for command line arguments.
      Parameters:
      options - The specified command line argument Options.
      helpFormatter - A HelpFormatter for displaying help information.

    • parseSampleInput

      private void parseSampleInput​(java.io.File file) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException, MusialIOException
      Populates the ArgumentsParser sampleInput and sampleNames property.

      If the passed File object points to a file, the properties are populated using the content from this file. The File object is expected to contain per line: A path to a .vcf file and optional comma-separated a sample name.

      If the passed File object points to a directory, the directory and all its sub-directories are searched for .vcf files which are used as sample input.

      Parameters:
      file - A File pointing to a .txt file specifying the sample input or a directory.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - If the passed file does not exist.
      MusialIOException - If the passed file does not exist, has no content or no read permission.

    • parseGeneFeatures

      private void parseGeneFeatures​(java.io.File file) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException, MusialCLAException, MusialIOException, MusialBioException
      Populates the ArgumentsParser includedGeneFeatures and pdbInputFiles property with the content from a File object. The File object is expected to contain per line: A String to match the feature from the Name attribute in the .gff files entries, (optional) an internal name for the feature, (optional) path to a .pdb file containing protein structure information of the feature.
      Parameters:
      file - A File pointing to a .txt file specifying the gene feature input.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - If the passed file does not exist.
      MusialIOException - If the passed file does not exist, has no content or no read permission.
      MusialCLAException - If any faulty command input is detected, i.e. missing parameters for single feature analysis.
      MusialBioException - If any faulty gene data is parsed, i.e. a gene with negative or zero length.

    • setSampleInput

      public void setSampleInput​(java.io.File newFile, int sampleIndex)
      Sets the input `.vcf` file of a sample to a new File.
      Parameters:
      newFile - The File the samples input should be set to.
      sampleIndex - The index of the sample in the samplesInput property.

    • getArguments

      public java.lang.String[] getArguments()
      Returns:
      The original command line arguments as Array of String.
